markdownRemark.html:
It's another ordinary day in my extraordinary life. With 11111 days of life behind me, I can surprisingly still pass as someone in their 30s. I feel like I can see past all the clocks and calendars of this world, breathing into my own timelessness.

Yesterday I was in the garden, tending to plants and the soil. I dug underneath the dirt to find new secrets, feeling exactly the same as I did when I was a child. I discovered little bits of joy and I felt like I was at the height of my being. I smiled and remember how this could be an everyday ritual.

Today I went for a walk through the woods, passing by the snow-capped mountains and towering trees. I stopped to get a better look at a particular snowflake and admired the way each one is unique and the moment was so still and calm. I am forever thankful to be able to experience the beauty of nature.

My memories are now part of a larger story, one that is wonderfully painted with the help of my past. Going through my diary, I am able to look back and take the lessons I've learnt and apply them to my present life. The moments that were filled with joy, sadness, and even pain are now complete and together, they create a captivating picture of an ever-lasting life.
